text: We have Rosalino with Elisa.

Every year, millions of
children in Latin America

begin consuming ultra processed
foods at just six months of age.

Outdated regulations
in the region

allow for artificial ingredients
and added sugars in baby food.

The proliferation of ultra
processed foods in major cities

makes these options a norm, and
importing all natural options

from abroad simply
isn't affordable.

All of this results in Latin
America as a region having

one of the highest child
obesity rates in the world,

with Mexico actually
ranking number one globally.

But Latin America is actually
an agricultural powerhouse,

and is the number one exporter
of fresh and organic produce
to the rest of the world.

A massive opportunity exists to
nourish Latin America's children
with local, nutrient-rich foods.
And that's why we created Elisa.

We are the first healthy and
accessible children's food
company in Latin America.

We started with
infant foods, where

we're leveraging local and
tropical ingredients grown

in our region, such as
avocado, guava, and amaranth,

to make highly nutritious
purees that meet a child's
early development needs.

All without any added
sugars or weird ingredients.

And we're able to offer
these for less than 2x

the cost of ultra
processed alternatives,

thanks to a direct
sourcing model
and in-house manufacturing.

I'm extremely excited by
what we've accomplished
over the past 18 months.

We've transitioned from being
a B2C company with world class

customer service, to
signing contracts with three

of Mexico's largest retailers,
including Walmart, which

is actually Latin America's
largest supermarket chain,
with thousands of stores.
Congratulations, Katie, as well.

We started this company
to democratize access
to healthy foods for children.

So please join us in providing
70 million children in Latin

America with all natural,
additive-free foods

during the most crucial
stage of their lives.
Thank you.
